data.title: Require url intellisense gone?
data.body:
One of the features that I really liked with vscode was the folder path intellisense inside require('path') while doing NodeJs development. Now I just see a list of global variables. I don't use the new salsa, and I'm targeting ES5. 

Something that might be worth mentioning is that the intellisense of the required modules is working as before.

data.title: [sass] @each loop shows error if there's a comma after the first variable.
Running batch files does not prompt user

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I'm on Win7 and running my build scripts (BATCH) through `cmd /C make.bat`. So I've set up my `tasks.json` to the following

```
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "cmd", 
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "showOutput": "silent",
    "args": ["/C"],

    "tasks": [
        {
        "taskName": "Build",
        "suppressTaskName": true,
        "isBuildCommand": true,
        "args": ["${cwd}/make.bat"]
        }
    ]
}
```

And my `make.bat` consists of:

```
@echo off
echo Building...
echo Done!
choice /C YN /T 10 /D Y /M "Window will close in 10 seconds..."
IF %ERRORLEVEL% == 2 PAUSE
```

Which works fine in normal execution:

```
Building...
Done!
Window will close in 10 seconds... [Y,N]?Y
```

But through tasks the last prompt never executes. Script continues forever and nothing gets printed to Output in VSCode. Same goes for if a script ends with a `PAUSE`. Nothing gets printed and script runs until you terminate it.

data.title: Misleading error message
data.body:
Testing a project [redux-saga](https://github.com/yelouafi/redux-saga) with neither a jsconfig.json or tsconfig.json. VSCode 0.10.8, TS 1.8.0 

If I enable Salsa via **VSCODE_TSJS** env variable, getting errors with ES6 .js files in first line with the import.

_Cannot compile modules unless the '--module' flag is provided. Consider setting the 'module' compiler option in a 'tsconfig.json' file._

Without Salsa its fine.  
Getting hard to tell if this Typescript, VSCode issue or something else.

data.title: Opening Explorer View forces .md editor out of Preview mode
data.body:
- Open markdown file in preview mode while sidebar is closed. 
- Open Explorer View sidebar

Expected: markdown file stays in preview mode
Actual: file switches to source mode

```
Version 0.10.8
Commit db71ac615ddf9f33b133ff2536f5d33a77d4774e
Date 2016-02-05T10:10:11.194Z
Shell 0.35.6
Renderer 45.0.2454.85
Node 4.1.1
```

data.title: Invalid result while indenting code with tab button
data.body:
Hello, I am using OS X EL Capitan(10.11.3) and vscode : Version 0.10.8 (0.10.8).
Following steps gives me invalid result and code loss:
1. write few lines of code
2. select those lines (Shift+arrow key)
3.press tab, and you will indent the code.
4.But if you press cmd+s (for saving file) and again pressed a tab button(while the code is selected already), the code vanishes leaving behind 3-4 last characters of those lines.

My concern is before indenting the selected code with tab button if you pressed cmd+s :+1 it should not affect the indentation or replace it with unwanted code.

Hope you are able to replicate it :)
Thanks in advance..

data.title: [csharp] Unused variable warning, but variable is written
data.body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12577765/12968515/14730ad4-d041-11e5-9206-c75112175524.png)

I wanted to title this "It's not just a mouthwash!" but...
Anyway, this brought me back to making sure I knew about scope - when I have a variable outside of the if statement, and then reference it inside the if statement, the system shouldn't complain about that. It's perfectly valid syntax. Why does VSCode think my variable is unused? 

This is a C# file (which the little info in the bottom info bar agrees with), running 0.10.8, on Mac OS X Yosemite. This appears to be a new issue.

data.title: Issues with JS and TextDocumentContentProvider

TextDocumentContentProvider works. I used this as a starting point https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-extension-samples/tree/master/textdocumentprovider-sample

This works if you save it as an html file and open it in a browser, but not if I return it in provideTextDocumentContent:

Is there a way to make it work or debug?

data.title: Can't link "Named Tasks" to preLaunchTasks
data.body:
I don't know if this is an issue in VSCode documentation or VSCode itself, but evidently it is [not possible to have a preLaunchTasks setting that is capable of referencing a task](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/35327016/using-prelaunchtasks-and-naming-a-task-in-visual-studio-code).

I'm having this problem on my Windows 10 machine, with the 0.10.8 version of VSCode.

data.title: marker view truncates text

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Please refer to this screenshot:

![vscode-truncated-text](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1445483/12964156/985210d6-d01c-11e5-9171-f97e03aa341a.png)

It appears as though the command palette is truncating parts of the text, and likewise mousing over these messages does _not_ show a tooltip with all the text.

From what I can see, there is no way to see the entire text.

I believe that the proper behavior would either be to:
- show all the text with no action
- or mouse over the message and show a tooltip to display all the text

data.title: Failed to load eslint library. Please install eslint in your workspace folder using 'npm install eslint' or globally using 'npm install -g eslint' and then pres
data.body:
Hi folks,

I several time during using VS Code see error like this:

> Failed to load eslint library. Please install eslint in your workspace folder using 'npm install eslint' or globally using 'npm install -g eslint' and then pres

Of course i`ve tried to install it locally and globally as well, but no result - still the same error.
My OS - Windows 10. Version of VS Code - 0.10.8 

Does somebody has the same issue and maybe you have thoughts how to fix it?
Thanks.

data.title: Keep undo history even when file changes outside Code
data.body:
When a file is being modified in Code, then an external process modifies something in the file, for example a code formatter, the modification is loaded instantly in Code, but all the history is lost.
Expected behavior would be to have the external modification, as one entry in the history.
### Steps to reproduce:

1 - Start a new file in `VS Code` and start typing in the file, then save the file. Keep the file and `VS Code` open.
2 - Open the same file in another editor. Modify some thing and save.
3 - Go back to `VS Code` , there is not 'Undo' available.

data.title: Built in Typescript support needs tsconfig.json, even when it is not used for Typescript compilation
data.body: I've discovered that the built-in Typescript editor support uses tsconfig.json, allowing VS Code to find references in other files in the source root without requiring an explicit /// <reference path=".  I'm not using tsconfig.json with gulp-typescript, so I found it very confusing when my references disappeared after deleting tsconfig.json.  Also, this requires me to have my Typescript config in 2 locations.  I suggest clearly documenting the VS Code dependency on tsconfig.json and/or using a separate config file for VS Code Typescript editor support.

data.title: regex sub match math
data.body:
```
Test 300
Test 301
Test 302
```

I can use regex find to loop through these:

```
Test (3[0-9]*)
```

When I try replace with math it concatenates instead of evaluates?

```
Test $1-100
```

So, it becomes:

```
Test 300-100
```

Is it possible to evaluate instead of concatenate, so it becomes:

```
Test 200
```

It works in vim regex:

```
%s@Test (3[0-9]*)@\='Test '.(submatch(1)-100)@
```

Thanks.

data.title: Question - how to set a given language per filetype extension?
data.body: I'm working with a lot of legacy asp code, vbscript and such. VSCode doesn't recognize asp/aspx file extensions so it defaults to plaintext. How do I tell VSCode that I want it to read my asp/aspx files as Visual Basic (even though it's not exactly right, it's close enough)?

data.title: Holding down shift still types lower-cased letters
data.body: If I hold down the left shift key and type letters, they will be capitalized. However, if I hold down left shift, type a letter, then press the right shift key, then release the left shift key, the next character I type will be lowercased. This is specific to VS Code. I have tried it in other applications, and they all still type capital letters after switching to the right shift key.
